page.title: 10WITHERS FRUIT FARM
page.content: The 800 acres of this farm lie west of Wellington Heath on south facing slopes at an altitude of 400 feet which{reduces the likelihood of frost. The bad winter and spring of 1985 had no adverse effect on the blossom which was well serviced by the{resident {bees. Modern sprays and weedkillers have made very{intensive}growing possible. Inefficient blackcurrant bushes were recently replaced with a new variety of smaller{spindle apple trees}which can be planted at the rate of 300 to 400 per acre instead of the usual 100. Whilst these mature, crops of {strawberries}are grown in between. A new strain called{Totem}which is firm and red all through and therefore more suitable for jam, freezing and travel, has been introduced. Gooseberries are grown in between young plum trees.
